newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Yugo Bor copper complex to invest $40 mln in '97.
newsitem.headline: Yugo Bor copper complex to invest $40 mln in '97.

text.p: Yugoslavia's mining and smelting complex Rudarsko-topionicarski basen Bor (RTB Bor) plans to invest $40 million of its own funds in reconstructing production capacities in 1997, an RTB Bor source said Tuesday.

"The funds will be used to continue reconstruction of the Majdanpek and Jama pit mines, begin expanding the Veliki Krivelj surface mine, complete a Veliki Krivelj-Bor transport system and purchase processing plant equipment," an RTB Bor source told Reuters.

RTB Bor, which groups some 20 enterprises employing more than 20,000 people, said it plans to raise copper concentrate output to nearly 80,000 tonnes and to produce nearly 140,000 tonnes of cathode copper in 1997.
The complex last month said 1996 cathode copper output was 104,500 tonnes, but added final year-end figures for other sectors were not available yet.
RTB Bor's metallurgy sector will process around 610,000 tonnes of domestic and imported raw materials this year.

Total exports of the Bor complex in 1997 are expected to reach $190 million, of which some $93 million would be net hard currency earnings, the same source said. -- Amra Kevic, Belgrade newsroom +381 11 2224305
